description: Premium skill marketplace at openclaw.design — browse, purchase, and download OpenClaw skill bundles via Stripe.

userStories.title: Project scaffold and dev environment
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a Next.js 15 app with Tailwind, HeroUI, and Drizzle ORM configured so we can build features incrementally.
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js 15 App Router project with TypeScript in root
Tailwind CSS + HeroUI (heroui.com, formerly NextUI) initialized via npx heroui-cli@latest init
Geist Mono + Geist Sans fonts configured (next/font/google or local) as primary typography
Drizzle ORM configured with Postgres connection (Neon or Vercel Postgres)
Environment variables documented in .env.example (DATABASE_URL, etc.)
npm run dev runs local server; npm run build succeeds
Typecheck/lint passes

userStories.title: Database schema — skills, users, purchases, reviews
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the core database tables so the app can store skills, user accounts, purchases, and reviews.
acceptanceCriteria: skills table: id, slug (unique), name, tagline, description (text), price_cents (int), currency, hero_image_url, category, published (boolean), created_at, updated_at
skill_versions table: id, skill_id (FK), version, changelog (text), bundle_url, created_at
users table: id, email (unique), name, avatar_url, stripe_customer_id, role (user/admin), created_at
purchases table: id, user_id (FK), skill_id (FK), skill_version_id (FK), stripe_payment_intent_id, amount_cents, currency, status, purchased_at
reviews table: id, user_id (FK), skill_id (FK), rating (1-5), body (text), created_at
Drizzle migrations generate and run successfully
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Authentication — NextAuth.js setup with GitHub OAuth
userStories.description: As a developer, I need NextAuth.js v5 configured with GitHub OAuth so users can create accounts and sign in.
acceptanceCriteria: NextAuth.js v5 (Auth.js) installed and configured in app
GitHub OAuth provider configured (client ID/secret in env vars)
Email/password credentials provider as fallback
Session strategy working (JWT or database sessions)
User record created in users table on first login
Auth environment variables documented in .env.example
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Sign in and sign up UI pages
userStories.description: As a user, I want clean sign-in and sign-up pages so I can create an account and log in.
acceptanceCriteria: Sign in page at /auth/signin with centered card on dark background
Sign in with GitHub button (prominent, with GitHub icon)
Divider with 'or continue with email'
Email + password input fields with Sign In button
Sign up link below the form
Protected routes redirect to /auth/signin when not authenticated
Signed-in users see avatar/name in nav instead of Sign In link
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Admin — create and list skills
userStories.description: As an admin, I need to create skills and see them in a list so I can populate the catalog.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin route at /admin/skills protected by admin role check (non-admins get 403)
List view showing all skills: name, slug, category, price, published status
Create skill form: name, slug, tagline, description (textarea), price (dollars input converted to cents), category dropdown, hero image URL
Submitting form creates skill record in database
New skills default to published: false (draft)
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Admin — edit skill, publish/unpublish, upload versions
userStories.description: As an admin, I need to edit skills, toggle publish status, and upload new versions with bundles.
acceptanceCriteria: Edit skill page at /admin/skills/[id]/edit with pre-filled form
All skill fields editable (name, tagline, description, price, category, hero image URL)
Publish/unpublish toggle button that updates the published field
Upload new version form: version string, changelog text, bundle zip URL
Version record created in skill_versions table
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Skill catalog — browse page with grid of skill cards

Hero headline: Premium Skills for Your AI Agent, subtext, Browse Marketplace CTA
Dark theme matching openclaw.ai aesthetic (deep navy/charcoal, not pure black)
SEO meta tags on homepage (title, description, Open Graph)

userStories.title: Skill catalog — filtering by category and sorting
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to filter skills by category and sort them so I can find what I need.
acceptanceCriteria: Category filter (top bar or sidebar) with options: All, Productivity, Communication, Development, Media, Automation, Smart Home
Sort dropdown: Newest, Price Low-High, Price High-Low, Highest Rated

Grid updates without full page reload
Empty state message when no skills match the filter

userStories.title: Skill detail page — hero, about, and sidebar

acceptanceCriteria: Dynamic route at /skills/[slug] that loads skill from database by slug
Hero section: large image with gradient overlay, skill name, tagline, price, Buy Now button
About section: full description rendered as rich text (markdown or HTML)
Sticky sidebar (desktop): price, Buy Now button, current version, category, install instructions preview
SSR with dynamic metadata for SEO (title, description, Open Graph image)
404 page if slug not found

userStories.title: Skill detail page — how it works, creator story, changelog
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see how a skill works, who made it, and its version history before buying.
acceptanceCriteria: How It Works section on detail page: numbered steps with icons or placeholder images
Creator Story section: narrative text with author name and avatar
Changelog section: list of versions with dates and release notes from skill_versions table

userStories.title: Stripe checkout integration
userStories.description: As a user, I want to buy a skill with my credit card via Stripe so I can download and use it.
acceptanceCriteria: Buy Now button creates a Stripe Checkout session via server action
Session includes skill name, price, and metadata (skill_id, user_id)
User redirected to Stripe-hosted checkout page
Success URL: /purchases/[id]/success
Cancel URL: back to skill detail page
Stripe webhook handler at /api/webhooks/stripe
On checkout.session.completed: create purchase record in database, link to user and skill
Stripe customer created or linked on first purchase
Webhook events handled idempotently (duplicate events don't create duplicate purchases)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Skill bundle delivery and download
userStories.description: As a buyer, I want to download my purchased skill bundle so I can install it in my OpenClaw instance.
acceptanceCriteria: Purchase success page at /purchases/[id]/success shows confirmation with animated checkmark
SKILL.md content revealed inline on the success page (rendered markdown) with Copy to Clipboard button
Download .md button for single-file skills, Download zip button for multi-file bundles
Download endpoint generates a signed, time-limited URL (1 hour) for the bundle
Only the purchasing user can access the download (auth check on user_id)
Success page shows What's next 3-step install instructions: 1) Download/copy 2) Place in skills/ folder 3) Restart OpenClaw
Confirmation email sent via Resend with download link after purchase
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.description: As a logged-in user, I want to see my purchase history and re-download any skill I've bought.

My Purchases list: skill thumbnail, name, purchase date, version, price paid, download button, copy SKILL.md button
Re-download button generates a fresh signed URL for the bundle
View Receipt link (Stripe-hosted receipt URL stored from webhook)
Empty state with friendly message and Browse Skills CTA when no purchases

userStories.title: Skill search with preloaded suggestions
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to search for skills by keyword so I can quickly find what I need.

Empty state: 'No skills found' message with link to browse all

userStories.title: Legal pages — Terms, Privacy, Refund Policy
userStories.description: As a marketplace operator, I need legal pages so we can process payments through Stripe and comply with regulations.
acceptanceCriteria: Terms of Service page at /terms covering: account creation, purchasing, license to use purchased skills, prohibited uses, limitation of liability
Privacy Policy page at /privacy covering: data collected (email, payment info via Stripe), cookies, third-party services (Stripe, GitHub OAuth, Resend, Vercel Analytics)
Refund Policy page at /refunds covering: digital goods policy, when refunds are granted, how to request a refund

Gambling/betting skill disclaimer: legal language noting that skills related to gambling or betting are tools only, marketplace is not responsible for how they are used, user assumes all risk, must comply with local laws
All legal pages use clean readable typography, dark theme consistent with rest of site
Footer links to all three legal pages on every page
Typecheck/lint passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: One of our skills involves gambling/sports betting — legal language must cover this explicitly with proper disclaimers

userStories.title: Seed content — launch skills with descriptions and bundles
userStories.description: As a marketplace operator, I need at least 3-5 skills populated in the database with full content so the store isn't empty at launch.
acceptanceCriteria: Database seed script or admin-created entries for at least 5 launch skills
Each skill has: name, tagline, full description, category, price, hero image URL, at least one version with a SKILL.md bundle
Each skill has a How It Works section and Creator Story written
Skills span at least 3 different categories to demonstrate filtering
At least one skill has a gambling/betting use case with appropriate description and disclaimers
Seed data can be run via a script (e.g. npm run seed) or created through admin UI
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Template for skill content: name, tagline, description (markdown), how-it-works steps, creator story, category, price

userStories.title: Email templates — welcome, purchase receipt, download link

Email templates use consistent dark-themed branding matching the site (HTML emails with inline styles)

Emails tested in development with Resend test mode
